meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used for opera glasses.
meanings.sent1: During the opera, she elegantly held her lorgnons to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: He always brings his lorgnons to the theater for a clearer look at the performers.
meanings.sent3: At the opera, he comically mistook his lorgnons for a pair of binoculars.
meanings.sent4: Her lorgnons were like a magic wand, revealing hidden details on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The lorgnons perched on his nose gave him a sophisticated air.

meanings.definition: To look at someone or something with lorgnons.
meanings.sent1: She lorgnoned at the painting, trying to decipher its hidden meaning.
meanings.sent2: He lorgnons at people passing by, always curious about their stories.
meanings.sent3: The detective lorgnoned at the suspect, trying to read his expression.
meanings.sent4: His eyes lorgnoned at the mysterious package left on his doorstep.
meanings.sent5: The teacher lorgnons at her students, noticing every detail in the classroom.
